means: 相信，信任（credit的现在分词形式）

sentence.Network_en: They are crediting science with power it doesn't possess.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们过分夸大了科学的力量。

sentence.Network_en: The staff are crediting him with having saved Hythe's life.
sentence.Network_cn: 职员们称赞他救了海丝的命。

sentence.Network_en: Improving the legislation and regulation on our crediting.
sentence.Network_cn: 其二,完善我国信用方面的法律法规.

PerfectNetExp.abs: the purpose of the sectoral crediting mechanism shall be to ., 部门入计机制的目的是.
credible 可信的，可靠的crediting 相信的
The informationization of crediting and credit management should adopt a step - by - step mode of development ., 授信与信贷管理系统信息化建设应该采用逐步推进的方式.

list.abs: 介词短语_百度百科 ... I. D. card 身份证 credit card 信用卡 no doubt 无疑，必定.
外贸英语词汇英汉全对照 [南方网教育频道] ... 有效至**: valid till ** 出口信贷 export credit 出口津贴 export subsidy.
瑞士信贷(Credit Suisse)周一发表评论称，黄金价格的上涨只有在最初塞浦路斯考虑向银行储户征税的时候，并且上涨的行情稍纵即逝。
信用风险（Credit Risk）主要指签约方没有履行契约责任给另一方造成经济损失的风险。相比市场风险，很多机构面对信用风险程度 …

entry.def: If you are allowed credit, you are allowed to pay for goods or services several weeks or months after you have received them.

example.ex: The group can't get credit to buy farming machinery...
example.tran: 这些人无法赊购到农用机械。

example.ex: You can ask a dealer for a discount whether you pay cash or buy on credit.
example.tran: 无论是付现还是赊购，都可以要求经销商打折。

entry.def: If someone or their bank account is in credit, their bank account has money in it.

example.ex: The idea that I could be charged when I'm in credit makes me very angry...
example.tran: 想到账户里有余额时还要收费，我就非常气愤。

example.ex: I made sure the account stayed in credit...
example.tran: 我确保账户里有余额。

entry.def: When a sum of money is credited to an account, the bank adds that sum of money to the total in the account.

example.ex: She noticed that only $80,000 had been credited to her account...
example.tran: 她注意到自己的账户里只存进了80,000美元。

example.ex: Midland decided to change the way it credited payments to accounts...
example.tran: 米兰银行决定改变付款贷记的方式。

entry.def: A credit is a sum of money which is added to an account.

example.ex: The statement of total debits and credits is known as a balance.
example.tran: 总借记和总贷记的结算即账户余额。

entry.def: A credit is an amount of money that is given to someone.

example.ex: Senator Bill Bradley outlined his own tax cut, giving families $350 in tax credits per child...
example.tran: 比尔·布拉德利参议员概述了自己的减税计划，提出每个孩子可为家庭减免350美元的课税。

example.ex: Japan has provided about $2.5 billion in credits to Russia and about $50 million in direct aid.
example.tran: 日本向俄罗斯提供了约25亿美元的借款和价值约5,000万美元的直接援助。

entry.def: If you get the credit for something good, people praise you because you are responsible for it, or are thought to be responsible for it.

example.ex: We don't mind who gets the credit so long as we don't get the blame...
example.tran: 谁受到表扬无所谓，只要我们不挨批就好。

example.ex: It would be wrong for us to take all the credit...
example.tran: 如果我们把所有功劳都揽到自己身上，那就不对了。

entry.def: If people credit someone with an achievement or if it is credited to them, people say or believe that they were responsible for it.

example.ex: The staff are crediting him with having saved Hythe's life...
example.tran: 职员们称赞他救了海丝的命。

example.ex: The 74-year-old mayor is credited with helping make Los Angeles the financial capital of the West Coast...
example.tran: 洛杉矶成为西海岸的金融中心，那位74岁的市长功不可没。

entry.def: If you credit someone with a quality, you believe or say that they have it.

example.ex: I wonder why you can't credit him with the same generosity of spirit...
example.tran: 我想知道你为什么不认为他具有同样崇高的思想境界。

example.ex: They are crediting science with power it doesn't possess.
example.tran: 他们过分夸大了科学的力量。

entry.tran: 为…赢得好感的人(或事物)
entry.def: If you say that someone is a credit to someone or something, you mean that their qualities or achievements will make people have a good opinion of the person or thing mentioned.

example.ex: He is one of the greatest British players of recent times and is a credit to his profession.
example.tran: 他是近代英国最伟大的运动员之一，是这一体育运动的骄傲。

entry.def: If you cannot credit something, you cannot believe that it is true.

example.ex: Roosevelt either did not learn of the scandal or refused to credit what he heard...
example.tran: 罗斯福要么是不知道那桩丑闻，要么是不相信他所听到的。

example.ex: It seems hard to credit that such things went on among senior Directors.
example.tran: 高级主管中竟发生了这样的事，真是令人难以置信。

entry.tran: 演职员表;摄制人员名单
entry.def: The list of people who helped to make a film, a CD, or a television  programme is called the credits .

example.ex: The star Marlon Brando wants his name removed from the credits.
example.tran: 影星马龙·白兰度要求把他的名字从演职员表中删掉。

example.ex: ...a moviegoer who remains in his seat until the credits are over.
example.tran: 直到演职员表播完才离座的影迷

entry.tran: (某些大学获得学位所必需的)学分，学习单元
entry.def: A credit is a successfully completed part of a higher education course. At some universities and colleges you need a certain number of credits to be awarded a degree.
If you say that something does someone credit, you mean that they should be praised or admired because of it.

example.ex: You're a nice girl, Lettie, and your kind heart does you credit.
example.tran: 你是个好女孩儿，莱蒂，你的善良值得称赞。

entry.tran: （某人的成绩或优点）值得表扬，应予肯定
entry.def: If you say 'credit where credit's due', you are admitting that you ought to praise someone for something that they have done or for a good quality that they possess.

example.ex: His gift was an extremely kind gesture. Credit where credit's due.
example.tran: 他的礼物是很友好的表示，这值得称赞。

entry.tran: 相信…具有(某种优良品质);称赞;认可
entry.def: To give someone credit for a good quality means to believe that they have it.

example.ex: Bratbakk had more ability than the media gave him credit for.
example.tran: 布拉特巴克比媒体称赞的要有才华。

entry.tran: (常用于提出缺点之后)就优点而言
entry.def: You say on the credit side in order to introduce one or more good things about a situation or person, usually when you have already mentioned the bad things about them.

example.ex: On the credit side, he's always been wonderful with his mother.
example.tran: 就优点而言，他对母亲一直很孝顺。

entry.def: If something is to someone's credit, they deserve praise for it.

example.ex: She had managed to pull herself together and, to her credit, continued to look upon life as a positive experience...
example.tran: 她已经努力振作起来，而且值得称赞的是，她仍然积极乐观地看待生活。

example.ex: Although the offences were horrific it was to her credit that she had owned up.
example.tran: 她的犯罪手段很残忍，但她的供认不讳还是可以认可的。

entry.def: If you already have one or more achievements to your credit, you have achieved them.

example.ex: I have twenty novels and countless magazine stories to my credit.
example.tran: 我著有20部小说，还在杂志上发表了无数篇文章。

auth_sentence.content: I have no problem crediting them for their work.
auth_sentence.res_content: I have no problem crediting them for their work.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I have no problem crediting them for their work.

auth_sentence.content: Hood says, crediting Japan's cultural tradition of bed rolls.
auth_sentence.res_content: Hood says, crediting Japan's cultural tradition of bed rolls.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Hood says, crediting Japan's cultural tradition of bed rolls.

auth_sentence.content: Crediting The Note, Tapped wrote, What about the national media?
auth_sentence.res_content: Crediting The Note, Tapped wrote, What about the national media?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Crediting The Note, Tapped wrote, What about the national media?
